title: About
text: I have always enjoyed being creative, working with others and pushing myself to grow. I am a passionate learner, enthusiastic designer and dedicated team member. My experiences with communication, media, leadership and organization drive my love for storytelling, community and hard work. I apply and live out those values in my experience with social media, graphic design, communication and photography.

title: Favre, Rodgers and Love: Are the GB QB stats coincidence or crucial?
text:
I’ll display the three GB QBs first year’s in comparison to the other active QBs in each year. I’ll highlight Favre, Rodgers and Love and make an observation from a scatterplot. The X and Y will represent stats like PassingTDs and TD/INT.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)
library(patchwork)




Code
F1 <- read_csv("data/Favre2.csv")
R1 <- read_csv("data/Rodgers1.csv")
L1 <- read_csv("data/Love1.csv")




Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_point(data=F1, aes(x=P_CmpP, y=P_Rate, size=P_TD), color=203731, alpha = .6) +
  geom_point(data=R1, aes(x=P_CmpP, y=P_Rate, size=P_TD), color="gold", alpha = .6) +
  geom_point(data=L1, aes(x=P_CmpP, y=P_Rate, size=P_TD), alpha = .6) + theme_minimal() +
    labs(
    x = "Pass Completion Percentage", y = "Passer Rating",
    title = "Green Bay's past three QBs: first year passing",
    subtitle = "The Packers' franchise QBs passing game by game shows...",
    caption = "By: Emily Stoner | Source: SportsReference: Pro-Football Reference"
  ) +
    scale_size(name="Passing TDs")











Code
#| include: false
ggsave("image.png")


Chart 2: How do first year QBs compare outside of Green Bay? I’ll look at a sample of first-year QB1s with a bar chart, to look at QBR, Completions and Passing Yards.


Code
Pass92 <- read_csv("data/92Passing.csv")
Pass93 <- read_csv("data/93Passing.csv")
Pass08 <- read_csv("data/08Passing.csv")
Pass23 <- read_csv("data/23Passing.csv")


add top 10 + relevant QB, do the thing where you show three bar charts at the same time + color + maybe switch to stacked


Code
barFavre92 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(
    data = Pass92 |> slice_max(Cmp, n = 10),
    aes(x = reorder(Player, Cmp), weight = Cmp),
    position = "identity",
    fill = "#DDDDDD"
  ) +
  geom_bar(
    data = Pass92 |> filter(Player == "Brett Favre"),
    aes(x = reorder(Player, Cmp), weight = Cmp),
    fill = 203731,
    position = "identity"
  ) +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "The top passers of the 1982 season, Favre at No. 3",
    x = "Top 10 Passers",
    y = "Season Completions",
    subtitle = "The Packers' franchise QBs passing game by game shows...",
    caption = "By: Emily Stoner | Source: SportsReference: Pro-Football Reference"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )




Code
barRodgers08 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(
    data = Pass08 |> slice_max(Cmp, n = 10),
    aes(x = reorder(Player, Cmp), weight = Cmp),
    position = "identity",
    fill = "#DDDDDD"
  ) +
  geom_bar(
    data = Pass08 |> filter(Player == "Aaron Rodgers"),
    aes(x = reorder(Player, Cmp), weight = Cmp),
    fill = "gold",
    position = "identity"
  ) +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "The top passers of the 2008 season, Rodgers...",
    x = "Top 10 Passers",
    y = "Season Completions",
    subtitle = "The Packers' franchise QBs passing game by game shows...",
    caption = "By: Emily Stoner | Source: SportsReference: Pro-Football Reference"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )




Code
barLove23 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(
    data = Pass23 |> slice_max(Cmp, n = 10),
    aes(x = reorder(Player, Cmp), weight = Cmp),
    position = "identity",
    fill = "#DDDDDD"
  ) +
  geom_bar(
    data = Pass23 |> filter(Player == "Jordan Love"),
    aes(x = reorder(Player, Cmp), weight = Cmp),
    fill = "black",
    position = "identity"
  ) +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    title = "The top passers of the 2023 season, Love...",
    x = "Top 10 Passers",
    y = "Season Completions",
    subtitle = "The Packers' franchise QBs passing game by game shows...",
    caption = "By: Emily Stoner | Source: SportsReference: Pro-Football Reference"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  )




Code
barFavre92









Code
barRodgers08









Code
barLove23











Code
barFavre92 / (barRodgers08 | barLove23)










plot_annotation( title = “Nebraska has a shot to snap their bowl drought”, subtitle = “Huskers match up well against the Bruins”, caption = “By: Emily Stoner | Source: SportsReference: Pro-Football Reference” ) & theme( plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = “bold”), axis.title = element_text(size = 16), plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12), panel.grid.minor = element_blank() )

Chart 3: With a step-chart, I’ll analyze how Favre and Rodgers’ games changed over the years, and see if we can make a prediction for where Love is headed.
